. A large part of the town was formerly named "Salem Village" and was where most of the accusers in the 1692 witch hysteria lived. The trials took place in neighboring

value: content=Ingersoll Street. M-F 9AM-dusk, Sa,Su 9AM-noon. Elaborate mansion and summer house with outstanding gardens. $2 donation. Guided tours May-July with reservations ($15).
content=June 15-Labor Day 12PM-4:30PM. Sept,Oct Sa,Su 12PM-4:30PM. Learn about colonial life and the infamous events of the witch trial era. Adults $5, under age 16 $3.
content=Major General Israel Putnam, American commander at Bunker Hill was born here in 1718. "Old Put" was famous for his command, "Don't fire 'til you see the whites of their eyes."
content=20 theaters including 1 IMAX theater. Great theater with good snacks, food, and friendly service. A lot of fun for midnight shows and premieres.
content=M-Su until frost 9AM-6PM. Pick your own of everything they have. Strawberries, raspberries, fresh flowers, peaches, blueberries, apples and pumpkins. Prices depend.
content=M-S in September 9AM-6PM; F-Sa in October 9AM-10PM; Su & Holiday's 9AM-6PM,

978-777-1245. Different pattern for the maze every year. Made famous from being in the news when a family called the police to come and help them out of the maze after being in there for only around 20mins. $9.50 all ages. Special prices for Halloween, haunted, and night time in the corn maze.
, Plains Park Holten Richmond Middle School, 7PM-10:30PM/fireworks start at 9:30PM,
978-777-0001 ext. 4. Live music, games, attractions, crafts, food.  Attend by the locals and surrounding towns. Seasonal in July.
978-777-0001 ext. 4.  Street fair with live music, food stands, raffles, airbrush tattoos, ice cream, and it is 1950's themed. Great family fun. Seasonal in June.
content=M private events; Tu-Th 4PM-9PM; F 4PM-11PM; Sa 10AM-11PM; Su 11AM-7PM,
978-762-8778. Live action multilevel laser tag. Great for the family. $9 general. $6 members.
978-777-0001 ext. 4.  Music, ice cream, rides and pie eating contest.Sample ice cream from many local ice cream parlors.  $5 for all you can eat ice cream $8 for ice cream and rides all day.
978-762-4800. 18 hole glow in the dark mini-golf course, arcade with tickets for prizes, and very family friendly. Adults $7.50, Children $6.50.
, 207 Boston Street, opening day 1PM-11PM; all other days 10AM-11PM,

978-887-5000.  Rides like a Ferris wheel and the zipper, games for prizes, food stands, booths, animals, petting zoo, elephant and camel to ride, beekeeping, flowers fruits and vegetables, largest pumpkin contest, concerts and more.  Weekday tickets $10, Weekends $12, (Children under 8 with an adult are FREE), Parking $10.

content=M-Sa 9AM-6PM. Owner Kelly Delaney is recognized as one of the nations baking experts. Featured on NBC's Today Show Destination Wedding Segment, Bostonâ€™s Fox 25 Morning News, TV Diner, and partnered with King Arthur Flour to kick-off their Baking Across America campaign. Great for cakes, pastries and cookies. Nut-free baking. Enjoyed by all Danvers locals.

978-774-0825. High fashion couture. Sells dresses, shoes, and other fashionable items. Great personalized service from the staff. Custom made dresses in sizes raging from 0-32. Great for weddings and proms. Go in advanced to leave time for dresses to be made.

content=M-Sa 10AM-9PM; Su 12PM-6PM. Has many shopping stores to chose from; A.C.Moore, Bed Bath & Beyond, Best Buy, Home Depot, Kohl's, Marshall's, Michaels, Nordstrom Rack, Off Broadway, Old Navy, Pier 1 Imports, Sports Authority, Staples, Target, Wet Seal etc. Also has many places to eat; Buffalo Wild Wings, Panera Bread, Dunkin' Donuts, the Food Court. The Liberty Tree Mall also includes one of the towns two movie theaters, AMC.
content=Open for Breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Diner atmosphere. A local favorite, great food, and very reasonably priced.
978-777-4199. Natural, organic, low-calorie, vegetarian, sugar-free food. Known for its Harvest Berry (frozen yogurt), wraps, and coffee.

content=Daily 12PM-10PM. Family owned 50's themed ice cream parlor. Sells ice cream, candy, pies, cakes, and food like hot dogs and popcorn. Offers discounts to North shore sports teams and caters parties.

978-739-9188. Szechuan and Cantonese food. Two time winner of the Readers Choice Award. Colorful interior and great food. Known for having a "Health Food Special Menu" that has steamed dishes with little oil and no sauce.
content=M-Sa 6AM-9PM; Su 6AM-8PM. Greek and American Food. Offers great salads, sandwiches and daily lunch specials. Warm environment, large portions, and friendly staff.
content=M-Th 11AM-11:30PM; F-Sa 11AM-12AM; Su 11AM-10:30PM. The first Roast Beef shop in town, loved by the locals and reasonably priced. Located in Downtown Danvers.

978-646-9201. Award winning food and service. Manager Jon, works hard to make everyone feel welcome. Known for their steaks, ribs, fresh-baked rolls, and ice cold beer. Entertainment from the line dancers and very friendly service. Also has a large beer and cocktail menu.

content=Everyday 11AM-1AM. Home of 'tablegating'. Great sports bar with a great drink menu. Great promotions like 50cent Wing Tuesdays. Also known for there 20 different sauces and seasonings for their famous wings. Indoor and outdoor seating.

978-774-1724. Sponsored by Bud Light. Great drink menu. Town favorite for football and just grabbing a drink. Many popular events and promotions like Bud Light Football. On the border of Danvers and Peabody.
content=New England Colonial style hotel with upgraded bathrooms, larger workspaces, and free Internet access.
content=Free HomeTouch hot breakfast buffet daily, nightly social events, and free high speed Internet.
